intro: Siparuna huilensis, commonly known as the Huilé Siparuna, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
